130002:
Closed Beta Test
Tester Terms of Service
(FINAL FANTASY VII EVER CRISIS)

Introduction:
These Terms of Service ("Terms") Testers (as defined below) participating in the Test (as defined below) of FINAL FANTASY VII EVER CRISIS ("the Game") as set forth below.
If you are under the age of thirteen (13), you cannot participate in this Test. If you are over the age of thirteen (13) (or other applicable minimum age in your place of residence) but under the age of eighteen (or other applicable age of majority in your place of residence), you must obtain consent from your parent or guardian before participating in this Test. 
Testers participating in this Test are deemed to have agreed to these Terms. 
You may not participate in this Test if you do not agree to these Terms. If you are under age and do not have the consent of your parent or legal guardian, you may not participate in this Test. Your participation in this Test constitutes proper acceptance of these Terms.

Article 1        Definition
1.  "Company" means Square Enix Co., Ltd.
2.  "Game" refers to FINAL FANTASY VII EVER CRISIS, the game maintained and provided by the Company.
3.  "Test" means a test using the beta version of the Game for final adjustment for completion of the commercial service version of the Game.
4.  "Tester" refers to the people who participate in the Test.
5.  "Terms" means this "Closed beta Test Tester Terms of Service" applicable to Testers participating in the Test.
6.  "Tester Data" refers to the data accumulated by the Company as a result of the participation of Testers in the Test.

Article 2         Application
These Terms apply to your participation in the Test. Tester shall comply with these Terms in participating in the Test. If Tester participates in the Test based on a service provided by a third party other than the Company, Tester shall comply with the terms provided by the third party (together with these Terms, "Terms and Rules") in addition to these Terms.

Article 3         Roles and Responsibilities of Testers
1.  Tester shall cooperate by reporting to Company any problems related to the software or usage environment of the Game discovered during the participation in the Test.
2.  Tester shall not disclose the ID and password used to participate in the Test (if applicable) to any third party, shall not allow any third party to use the Tester’s ID and/or password, and shall be responsible for the management of the Tester’s ID and password.
3.  Tester shall be responsible for any acts performed in this Test with its own ID and password (if applicable), whether or not the Tester performed such acts.

Article 4         Confidentiality Obligations
Tester shall not disclose to any third party any information concerning the specifications, technology, or defects of the Game which may be obtained through the Test or otherwise. 

Article 5         Prohibited Acts
Tester shall not engage in any of the following acts:
(1)  the act of assigning, leasing or transferring to another person all or part of the rights that a Tester has as a Tester, or providing for the sale, change of name, pledge or any other security;
(2)  commercial activities using the Test and participation in the Test for commercial purposes or preparation thereof; 
(3)  other acts in violation of these Terms and Rules; and
(4)  any other acts communicated by Company to Testers.

Article 6         Information
For the purpose of analyzing and improving the Game, the Company may upload information relating to the Test, including but not limited to information relating to the hardware, software and error logs as well as Tester Data from the Tester's hardware to the Company's servers, during the test period without obtaining the Tester's individual consent.

Article 7         Tester Data
The Tester Data accumulated by the Tester during the test period will not be transferred to the commercial service version of the Game.

Article 8         DISCLAIMER; SUSPENSION
1.  The Test is intended as a final adjustment for the completion of the commercial service version of the Game, and it is intended to test the Game under development. Therefore, the Game is provided "AS IS", and even if any defect or damage occurs to the Tester or the Tester's hardware, etc., as a result of the Tester's participation in the Test, the Company will not compensate for any such defect or damage. Testers participate in the Test at their own risk.
2.  The Company may suspend the Test or change the duration of the Test at its sole discretion.

Article 9         Ownership of Rights
Between Tester and the Company, the Company retains and will retain all rights in connection with the Game, and will retain all rights in connection with the Tester Data (including all intellectual property rights therein). Testers are only granted the right to access and use the Game to the limited extent permitted by these Terms and Rules.

Article 10         Personal Information
In conducting the Test, if the Company collects Tester's personal information, the Company shall collect and manage such personal information in accordance with the Company's Privacy Policy (https://square-enix-games.com/en_US/documents/privacy).

Article 11         Changes to these Terms
Company reserves the right to modify these Terms at any time, including by posting updated terms on the Tester site (subject to applicable law). By continuing to use the Game after any such update you consent to the changes to the Terms. You may also be asked to affirmatively consent to updates to these Terms, and may be prevented from continuing to use the Game if you decline to accept such an update.

Article 12        Governing Law
These Terms shall be governed by the laws and regulations of Japan with respect to all matters including their effect, interpretation and exercise. Tester agrees that the Tokyo District Court shall be the exclusive and agreed court of first instance for disputes relating to these Terms or the Test.

●前払式支払手段の名称
レッドクリスタル

●前払式支払手段の発行者の商号
株式会社スクウェア・エニックス

●前払式支払手段の支払可能金額等
成年：上限なし
未成年：
・16歳未満は、1ヶ月につき5,000円まで
・16歳以上は、1ヶ月につき30,000円まで
前払式支払手段の累積保有数：200,000個
※前払式支払手段（有償発行分に限る）の保有数が一定数以上の場合、前払式支払手段を購入することはできません。
※年齢は月単位で数えており、年齢到達月の翌月を満年齢としています。

●前払式支払手段の有効期間
無期限

●苦情又はご相談の窓口
インフォメーションセンター：0570-003-399
受付時間：月～金 11：00～19：00（土・日・祝日および弊社指定休日を除く）
東京都渋谷区桜丘町1番1号 渋谷サクラステージ SHIBUYAタワー

●前払式支払手段の使用可能範囲
「FINAL FANTASY VII EVER CRISIS」のアプリ内

●前払式支払手段の利用上の必要な注意
以下に定める利用規約の「ゲーム内通貨」に関する規定をご確認ください。

●前払式支払手段の未使用残高の確認方法
「FINAL FANTASY VII EVER CRISIS」のアプリ内でご確認いただけます。

●前払式支払手段の未使用残高の保全
当社は、資金決済に関する法律に基づき算出した基準日（毎年3月31日及び9月30日時点）における未使用残高の2分の1以上の金額を供託することにより、前払式支払手段にかかる未使用残高の保全をしています。当社が破綻等した場合、未使用残高の保有者は、この供託金（発行保証金）から、保有する未使用残高に関して、優先して弁済を受ける権利がありますが、必ずしも全額の保全が図られているわけではありません。

●不正利用による損失の補償等に関する方針
当社は、前払式支払手段の不正利用（前払式支払手段の保有者の意思に反した、権限を有しない者の指図による前払式支払手段の利用のことをいいます）により、当該保有者に生じた損失について、利用規約又は法令に基づき当社が責任を負う場合を除き、一切の責任を負わないものとします。なお、不正利用に関するお問い合わせは、上記「苦情又はご相談の窓口」宛にお願いいたします。

●利用規約
ユーザー規約（「FINAL FANTASY VII EVER CRISIS」）をご確認ください。

<align="center">（FINAL FANTASY VII EVER CRISIS）</align>


お客様（以下「ユーザー」といいます）による、株式会社スクウェア・エニックス（以下「当社」といいます）が提供する表題記載のサービス（以下「本サービス」といいます）の利用については、このユーザー規約（以下「本規約」といいます）が適用されます。ユーザーは、本サービスの利用にあたり、本規約に加えて、本サービスが提供されるマーケット、ストア等の利用規約（以下「ストア利用規約」といいます）についても遵守してください。

ユーザーが未成年の場合：
* 保護者の明確な同意を得たうえで、本規約に同意してください。
* 本サービスの利用が日常生活に支障をきたすことのないよう、本サービスの利用時間等につき、保護者と相談をして決めてください。

1.  本サービスの利用許諾

本規約に同意することを条件として、当社はユーザーに対して、本サービス（ソースコード及びオブジェクトコードを除きます）を個人的に利用する非独占的な権利を許諾します。
ユーザーは、本サービスの性質上、本サービスが当社の合理的な裁量に基づき変更、中断、利用制限され、また提供が終了することを理解した上で本サービスを利用するものとします。
なお、本規約以外に、本サービスに関する追加または異なる取引条件を定めるガイドライン、ルール、利用条件、販売条件等（以下「追加規約」といいます）が存在する場合、これらもユーザーによる本サービスの利用に適用されます。本規約と追加規約が矛盾する場合、追加規約が優先して適用されます。ただし、追加規約に本規約が優先されることが明示的に記載されている場合は、この限りではありません。

2.  禁止行為

当社は、全ての利用者に楽しい体験をしていただくため、また、当社の知的財産権を守るために、本条に定める行為（以下「禁止行為」といいます）を厳に禁止します。なお禁止行為には、禁止行為の準備行為や禁止行為をほう助したり、そそのかしたりする行為も含まれます。
当社は、ユーザーが本規約に違反した場合、または禁止行為を行った場合（禁止行為を行ったと当社が信じるに足る合理的な理由がある場合を含みます）、当該違反及び行為の内容に応じ、当社の合理的な裁量により、以下を含む様々な対応を行うことができます。なお、当社はユーザーの行為が禁止行為に該当するか否かを調査する目的で、一時的に以下に定める措置をとる場合があります。
•  警告
•  不正に取得したゲーム内アイテムまたは通貨の削除
•  ゲーム内通貨購入の一時的又は永久的な制限
•  アカウントの一時的又は永久的な停止
•  契約違反、著作権侵害その他の理由による法的措置（訴訟、差し止めを含みます）

2.1  アカウント情報の共有  ユーザーはストア利用規約で許される場合を除き、アカウント情報またはログイン情報を他者と共有しないものとします。

2.2  阻害行為  ユーザーは、当社のコンピュータ及びサーバーの阻害を含み、当社及び他の利用者による本サービスの利用を阻害しないものとします。阻害行為には、本サービスに関するカスタマーサポート窓口に過度の問い合わせを送るなどして、他の利用者による正当なカスタマーサポートの利用を阻害する行為が含まれます。

2.3  誹謗中傷  ユーザーは、本サービスの利用において、通常の人間が、攻撃的、わいせつ、過激、その他不適切と考えるであろう表現を用いないものとします。

2.4  なりすまし  ユーザーはいかなる個人または団体にもなりすましてはならず、また、自身を当社の従業員、代表者その他当社の関係者であるかのように詐称してはならないものとします。ユーザーの安全のために、当社はユーザーが自身のプライバシーに配慮し、匿名性を維持し、他の利用者に対して個人情報を提供しないことを推奨します。 

2.5  当社及び第三者の名称、知的財産権等の使用  ユーザーは、当社、その他の第三者が有する名称その他の知的財産権（ユーザー名やキャラクター名を有名人、企業、商品または既存のキャラクターの名称にすることを含みます）を本サービスにおいて使用しないものとします。

2.6  違法行為  ユーザーは、本サービスに関連して違法行為を行わないものとします。違法行為には、著作権侵害、商標権侵害、ギャンブル、中傷、脅迫、詐欺等を含みます。

2.7  偽の情報の提供  ユーザーは、本サービスの利用にあたり、当社及び本サービスが提供されるマーケット、ストア等に対して偽の情報を提供してはならないものとします。

2.8  ハラスメント  ユーザーは、本サービスの利用に関連して、他の利用者、当社、その他の第三者に嫌がらせを行ってはならないものとします。

5.  ゲーム内通貨

5.1  ゲーム内通貨の導入  本サービスでは本サービス内でのみ利用可能な仮想の通貨（以下「ゲーム内通貨」といいます）を採用する場合があります。ゲーム内通貨は、当社が本サービス内で提供する一定のバーチャルな商品またはサービスを取得するために利用することができます。

5.2  ゲーム内通貨は、アカウント等の一部をなし、当社は、ユーザーにその利用のみを許諾しています。適用法令に異なる定めがある場合を除き、ゲーム内通貨は何らの換価価値を有さず、ユーザーはゲーム内通貨を本規約に従って利用する権利の他、何らの権利も有さず、当社が当社の裁量でゲーム内通貨と交換可能と定めるバーチャルな商品またはサービスを除き、現金、通貨、ライセンスまたは権利等、いかなるものとも交換することはできません。ユーザーはゲーム内通貨をいかなる個人または団体に対して移転することはできず、また、いかなる個人または団体からも受領することはできません。

5.3  ゲーム内通貨の追加  当社が本サービスにおいてゲーム内通貨を採用した場合、ユーザーは、本サービスが定める支払方法を利用することにより、ユーザーのアカウントにゲーム内通貨を追加することができます。未成年のユーザーが保護者名義のクレジットカード等の支払手段を利用する場合は、当該保護者の明示的な同意を得なければならないものとします。当社は通知なく当社の裁量でいつでもゲーム内通貨の価格を変更する権利を有するものとします。ユーザーは、ゲーム内通貨の追加に要する金額にかかる税金等の支払い責任を負うものとします。

5.4  ゲーム内通貨に係る制限  ユーザーの安全を確保し、詐欺等による被害を防止することを目的として、当社は本サービスにおいてユーザーに許諾される一回当たりまたは月あたりのゲーム内通貨の数もしくは使用金額に制限を設けることができます。同様に、当社はユーザーがユーザーのアカウント内に保有できるゲーム内通貨等の数に制限を設けることができるものとします。

5.5  ゲーム内通貨の利用  ユーザーはゲーム内通貨を、当社が本サービス内で提供する一定のバーチャルな商品またはサービスに交換することができます。当社はいつでも当社の裁量により、ユーザーに対して通知することなく個別の商品またはサービスと交換するために必要となるゲーム内通貨の数を変更する権利を留保します。一旦商品またはサービスと交換したゲーム内通貨はユーザーのアカウントから減らされ、再度利用することはできません。また、ユーザーは一度完了した取引（ゲーム内通貨と本サービス内のバーチャルな商品またはサービスとの交換をいいます）を取り消すことはできません。ただし、当社は、不正な取引が確認された場合、当該取引を取り消しまたは無効とする権利を留保します。

9.12 サポートセンター  本サービスについてご質問等がある場合には、本サービスまたは本サービスの公式サイトに記載したサポート窓口までお問い合わせください。

10.  本サービス内のバーチャルな商品及びサービスの扱いについて

本サービス内のバーチャルな商品のうち、別途「資金決済法に基づく表示」と題するページに前払式支払手段として表示するゲーム内通貨は、「資金決済に関する法律」に基づき前払式支払手段として取扱われます。当該前払式支払手段との交換により入手又は提供されたその他のバーチャルな商品及びサービスは、交換をもってこれにかかる商品・サービスの提供がなされたものとし、前払式支払手段に該当しません。

11.  ユーザー情報の外部送信について

本サービスにおいては、以下の外部サービスを利用しています。これらの外部サービスの提供者、利用目的及び提供されるユーザーの情報は、以下のとおりです。

・AppsFlyer（AppsFlyer Japan株式会社）
提供するユーザーの情報：①IDFA、AAID、Steam ID、購入履歴、ゲームの進捗情報、②IDFV、OS/ブラウザの種類やバージョン、デバイスの種類および画面サイズ、アプリの利用日時、購入履歴、ゲームの進捗情報、IPアドレス
利用目的：①カスタマイズされた広告配信、②パフォーマンスの測定

・BugSnag（SmartBear Software）
提供するユーザーの情報：ユーザーID、OS情報、デバイス名/スペック情報、クラッシュデータ、UUID
利用目的：クラッシュの調査・分析のため

230000000000001:
A journey of self-discovery surrounding the fate of the planet─
 
In the metropolis of Midgar, towering mako reactors drain the planet's lifeblood to fuel industrial greed. For the ex-SOLDIER Cloud, this city is where his battle begins─one that that will shape the future of humanity and the world.
230000000000002:
Men cry not for themselves but for their comrades─
 
As the war with Wutai nears its end, one SOLDIER instigates an uprising. In an attempt to take control of the situation, Zack, a SOLDIER who dreams of becoming a hero, sets out with a senior operative. However, what awaits them is a cruel fate no one could have foreseen.
230000000000003:
enソルジャーの秘められた真実が明かされる――
ソルジャーの世代交代が密かに進む時代。ミッドガル
から遠く離れた南の絶島で、神羅の期待を背負った
3人のソルジャーと、「英雄」と世界に名を轟かす
次世代ソルジャーの運命が交差する。

300000000000001: You must be the anti-SOLDIER\nmonsters I've been hearing about.
300000000000002: SOLDIER: Second Class Zack,\nvictorious once again!
300000000000004: What the hell is this!?\nC'mon, let's get rid of this thing!
300000000000005: I guess it's not a picky eater.
300000000000006: I'd rather not be devoured by a monster today, thanks.
300000000000010: I don't care. Just grab her.
300000000000012: Show me you deserve to be a First.
300000000000013: You're on!\nGet ready to pick your jaw up off the floor!
300000000000014: Show me what a future hero can do!
300000000000016: I've never seen anything like them before.\nMan, if only Matt were here.\nHe'd know what they were.
300000000000017: Who cares? Just focus on the battle!
300000000000018: I hate it when the garbage parties up.\nReminds me too much of us.
300000000000019: Then we're probably in for a good fight.\nDon't let your guard down.
300000000000022: Glenn, we won't last at this rate.\nWe'll expend our recovery measures before long.
300000000000023: It's not like we're fighting behemoths!\nThese guys are nothing!
300000000000028: No one gets in the way\nof Reno and the Turks...
300000000000029: Hey, didn't we already deal with this guy?
300000000000031: Then we defeat it again! As many times as it takes!
300000000000032: I see.\nWe won't be allies, then.
300000000000034: A summon!?\nSo that's how it is, huh!
300000000000036: If we die before we complete our mission,\nwe're gonna regret it 200% more than if\nwe had died under normal circumstances.
300000000000037: We won't have any regrets. We'll be dead.
300000000000038: He's right! If we die, we'll be no better than\nall the other disposable P0 SOLDIERs!
300000000000039: Hey, it's Stamp! Boy, you're gonna wish\nyou never saw me again!
300000000000040: That's likely the most powerful weapon\nin their arsenal.
300000000000041: It's an old model, so much so that it's not\nin my records. We'll have to improvise.
300000000000043: I hope that's the end of that.
300000000000045: He's huge...! Is that because of the mako!?
300000000000046: Dammit, how many times do we have to fight\nthis thing!? Guys, let's finish him for good!
300000000000047: If you want it back, you'll have to\npry it from my cold, dead hands!
300000000000049: Hey, are you listening to me!?
300000000000051: One more time! Let's go one more time!
300000000000055: It's hard to put it into words, so why don't\nwe show you what we mean instead?
300000000000057: I've never seen monsters like these before.
300000000000058: It doesn't matter.\nWe take down whatever's in our way.
300000000000062: We're running out of time.\nLet's do this quickly.
300000000000067: It must be a product of the island's raging\nmako... Or is it the will of the planet...?
300000000000068: Who cares!? As long as it stays the hell out\nof our way!
300000000000069: You think you can do whatever you want!?\nCome on! Bring it!
300000000000070: I don't have time for this!
300000000000072: I don't like being taken for a fool.
300000000000078: We'll take this codger down together!\nTime for teamwork, Sephiroth!
300000000000080: Haven't seen any beasts like this before...\nThey look as vicious as the environment\nthey're in.
300000000000081: If they're in our way, then we cut them down.
300000000000082: Easier said than done, I see.
300000000000083: Welcome wagon, huh?\nThen let me introduce myself!
300000000000084: Where the hell'd you come from?
300000000000086: I'm coming for you as soon as I'm done!
300000000000088: Maybe if you had asked nicely. But no dice!
300000000000089: Genesis copies again!\nThey're just running wild!
300000000000091: I wonder what'll happen to Junon\nif you can't stop them? Huh?
300000000000092: You're gonna destroy the gate\nto attack the people?\nYou won't get away with this!
300000000000093: Hollander! Once I catch you,\nI'll deck you good!
300000000000095: You really don't wanna mess with me\nright now!
300000000000096: I needed a little rehab anyway!
300000000000097: Really?\nAll this for just the two of us!?
300000000000099: Don't scare me like that!\nI thought you were Shinra.
300000000000100: You don't wanna get in my way\nwhen I'm hungry!
300000000000101: Oh, were you here first?\nSorry about this!
300000000000102: Don't let it get to you, Sephiroth!\nIt's only an illusion that you created!

481000000000011: After what happened to Nibelheim, I found myself at the station in the Sector 7 Slums—almost as if I were guided there. I reunited with Tifa, my childhood friend who had made this place her home, and we quickly began to make up for lost time.
481000000000021: Shinra took everything from me—my wife, my best friend, my right arm, my home. Marlene was all I had left, and I would've done anything to give her the life she deserves. But times were rough and I lost my direction until I met someone who showed me the way...
481000000000031: After suffering a horrific accident, I awoke in a clinic in the Sector 7 Slums. With nothing but a huge hospital bill to my name, I began a new life in Midgar—one that would soon lead me to make great friends and new precious memories.
481000000000041: I've always wanted to go on a picnic since I was little, and today's finally the day! But every time I try to have fun, something always seems to mess it up... Like that time I couldn't go out and celebrate my birthday. Will today be different? Will I finally get to enjoy a long-awaited picnic?

603000000010080:
- The period and content are subject to change without notice.
- A draw may yield duplicate weapons. As two of the same weapon cannot be held, any duplicates are placed in the armory.
- If a draw yields a higher rarity version of a weapon already held, it automatically replaces the currently held weapon. The weapon level of the lower rarity weapon is applied to the new weapon, and the lower rarity weapon is placed in the armory.
- Turning on auto-convert will automatically convert any weapons sent to the armory.
- Experiencing connectivity issues may result in skipped or faulty draw animations, but it will not affect the outcome of the draw. Please check the weapon list for confirmation.
- The displayed probability for each weapon obtainable from a draw is accurate to the fifth decimal place, even if it extends to or beyond the sixth. Therefore, please be aware that even if you add up all displayed probabilities, the total may not reach 100%, or the sum of the probabilities for a specific rarity may not match the listed probability for that rarity.
- Actual probabilities are neither rounded up nor down.
- Each draw is based on probabilities. Specific weapons are not guaranteed from a fixed number of draws.
- If both red and blue crystals are held, blue crystals will be used first.
- If the required number of premium draw tickets are held, they will be used before red or blue crystals.
- When performing a 10 Draw and a stamp is pressed within a weapon square on the Stamp Card, the tenth slot in that 10 Draw will yield the weapon on that square.
- The appearance rate of Ultimate Weapons is subject to change without prior notice.
- Ultimate Weapons are not limited-edition weapons. Newly introduced Ultimate Weapons will be included in certain upcoming Draws, in the same fashion as newly introduced weapons in past Featured Draws.
- The Ultimate Weapons cannot be selected in the Daily Quest ‘Weapon Parts Request’.

- Each draw is based on probabilities. Specific weapons are not guaranteed from a fixed number of draws.
- The displayed probability for each weapon obtainable from a draw is accurate to the fifth decimal place, even if it extends to or beyond the sixth. Therefore, please be aware that even if you add up all displayed probabilities, the total may not reach 100%, or the sum of the probabilities for a specific rarity may not match the listed probability for that rarity.
<color=#FF9292>*Actual probabilities are neither rounded up nor down.</color>

■ 1,200 Red Crystals + Bonuses (7 days)
Bonus 1: Stamina Boost Active - Battle Rewards x4 (Originally x3), x8 (Originally x6), x12 (Originally x9)

804000101006002:
■ 480 Red Crystals + Bonuses (7 days)
Bonus 1: More Co-op Medals Added to Rewards
Bonus 2: Synthesis Time Reduction -30%
Bonus 3: Chocobo Expedition Rare Drop Rate +30%
Bonus 4: Chocobo Expedition Time Reduction -30%

<color=#9DB2CC>*The effects of "Bonus 1: More Co-op Medals Added to Rewards" are shared with other players in the same lobby.
*You can hold up to 9,999 Co-op Medals.
*Co-op Medals acquired through the SOLDIER Pass cannot be kept if they exceed inventory capacity.</color>

804000101006004:

*The mission will reset every day at 12:00 PM PST/1:00 PM PDT.

The event "The Holy Flame's Gift" has kicked off at 6:00 PM on November 29 PST!
This event consists of <color=#95C7FF>Present Leveling Battles</color> and <color=#95C7FF>Score Battles</color>.
By clearing <color=#95C7FF>Present Leveling Battles</color>, you can raise your Present Level, which increases the number of items that you can obtain to attempt Score Battles.
Through <color=#95C7FF>Score Battles</color>, you can obtain materials based on your damage score that can be traded for valuable rewards such as exclusive weapons.
Exclusive weapons can also be obtained from present rewards and mission rewards.
*Exchange period is until Dec. 27 5:59 PM PST.
866000000008002:
"Valentine's Event: The Secret Sweetheart" has kicked off on Jan. 30 6:00 PM PST! The event consists of <color=#95C7FF>gathering leveling battles</color> and <color=#95C7FF>score battles</color>.

By clearing <color=#95C7FF>gathering leveling battles</color>, you can raise your item gathering level, which increases the number of items that you can obtain to attempt score battles.

Through <color=#95C7FF>score battles</color>, you can obtain materials based on your damage score that can be traded for valuable rewards such as exclusive weapons.

Exclusive weapons can also be obtained as item gathering rewards.
*Exchange period is until Feb. 20 5:59 PM PST.

866000000008004:
"A Tea Party & Festive Eggs" has kicked off as of Mar. 27 7:00 PM PDT! The event consists of <color=#95C7FF>Gathering Leveling Battles</color> and <color=#95C7FF>Score Battles</color>.

By clearing <color=#95C7FF>Gathering Leveling Battles</color>, you can raise your Item Gathering Level, which increases the number of items that you can obtain to attempt Score Battles.

Through <color=#95C7FF>Score Battles</color>, you can obtain materials based on your damage score that can be traded for valuable rewards such as exclusive weapons.

Exclusive weapons can also be obtained as Item Gathering rewards.
*Exchange period is until Apr. 23 6:59 PM PDT.

866000000014001:
As of Mar. 6 6:00 PM PST, the event "Escalation Challenge: Odin" is on now.
Escalation Challenges are high-difficulty content that challenge the player to see how high a level you can clear while the Escalation Level increases with each boss that is defeated.
In battles where the Escalation Level is 20 or lower, you can obtain items such as Escalation Medals as First Clear Rewards.
In addition, by clearing battles with an Escalation Level of 21 or higher, you can earn a title for each level.
*From level 21 onwards, titles can be earned as rewards for the General Mission, and missions can also be completed by completing another upcoming Escalation Challenge.

Escalation Medal is obtainable as a First Clear Reward in the Escalation Challenge.
Escalation Medals can be exchanged for a Premium Draw Ticket, a Greater Power Branding Stone, and more.
*Escalation Medals have no expiration date.
*The Escalation Medal Exchange will periodically reset the number of available exchanges and update its lineup.
*The next update of the exchange is scheduled for May 28 7:00 PM PDT.

902000000010001:
Former SOLDIER: First Class.
Joined the operations of the anti-Shinra
organization Avalanche at the request of his
childhood friend Tifa.
902000000010002:
A leader in the anti-Shinra organization
Avalanche. Of brawny build and with
a weaponized prosthetic right arm. 
A man of impulsive action, his hatred for
Shinra runs deep.
902000000010003:
A member of the anti-Shinra organization
Avalanche, and Cloud's childhood friend.
Runs Seventh Heaven in the Sector 7 slums.
902000000010004:
A young woman who sells flowers.
She lives in the Sector 5 slums and tends
to the flowers that bloom in an abandoned
church on the edge of town.
902000000010005:
A beast with red fur and a fiery tail.
One of a long-lived species with
intelligence equal to that of humans, 
he is held captive in Professor Hojo's lab as
a research specimen.
902000000010006: The amazing materia hunter and self-professed ninja beauty. After losing the war against Shinra, she strives to rebuild her hometown of Wutai and restore the people's spirits.
902000000010007: A self-professed fortune-telling machine. Also a jokester and beloved mascot of the Gold Saucer. Megaphone in hand, this stuffed cat barks orders in battle from atop a moogle.
902000000010008: A former member of the Turks. Burdened by guilt for past deeds, for years he slept in the basement of the Shinra Manor.
902000000010009: A legendary pilot. He maintains the town's rocket as he dreams of one day going to space.
902000000010010:
A SOLDIER: First Class who was once
revered as a hero. He was presumed to have
died during a certain mission, but the details
of his death are unknown. 
His fate is seemingly intertwined with that of
Cloud's, a fellow SOLDIER who had
accompanied him on that mission.
902000000010020:
A member of SOLDIER. 
He dreams of becoming a hero like
Sephiroth and eagerly awaits opportunities
to prove his merit.
902000000010049:
A young SOLDIER: First Class who is
recognized by many as a hero.
Though the youngest member of Glenn's
team, he fearlessly leads them through
enemy territory.
902000000010050:
Shinra SOLDIER: P0 Class.
He volunteers for a dangerous mission in
enemy territory—one with a large reward—to
locate a site for the construction of a mako
reactor.
902000000010051:
Shinra SOLDIER: P0 Class.
He uses his memory and judgment that
earned him the nickname "Professor" as
he joins Glenn on his mission.
902000000010052:
Shinra SOLDIER: P0 Class.
An advisory officer for the military, she joins
Glenn on his mission to exercise her skills as
a sniper.
902000000010056: A member of SOLDIER. Earnest and hardworking, he never hesitates to lend others a hand. Despite being a SOLDIER: Second Class, he was appointed team leader over the First Class Sephiroth.
902000000020001:
An old church at the edge of the Sector 5
Slums. Despite the desolate environment,
flowers bloom inside its walls.
902000000020002:
Farms for raising chocobos. At the chocobo
farm run by Bill in the Grasslands Area, you
can trade chocobo medals for chocobos or
go on expeditions with your feathered
friends.
902000000020003:
A fort in Mt. Tamblin belonging to the
Wutaian army. Within its thick walls is a
heavily-guarded entryway with a corridor
meant to disorient invaders.
902000000020004:
A multi-story pavilion in the inner garden of
Fort Tamblin. Though a training facility for
Wutaian fighters, large monsters stand ready
in case of invasion by Shinra troopers.
902000000020005:
A SOLDIER training facility within the
Shinra Building. The VR technology allows
for combat training in various situations.
902000000020006:
An area for SOLDIERs on standby.
It has rooms for meetings and training that
are also utilized by scientists researching
combat materia.
902000000020007:
The main means of transportation in Midgar,
run by Shinra's railway division.
The trains provide service to atop the plates
as well as the slums.
902000000020008:
An archipelago inhabited by a people with a
unique culture who were once allied with
Shinra. After they withdrew from the alliance
a decade ago, they were subsequently
annihilated by Shinra forces.
902000000020009:
A means to communicate with those on
the main island of Rhadore. White smoke
indicates that all is well, yellow irregularity, 
and red the need for immediate evacuation
—and danger for the Eye of Rhadore.
902000000030002:
An epic poem passed down from ancient
times. Many interpretations of the work exist,
including plays and films, and it is currently
enjoying a popular run at the playhouse in
Sector 8.
902000000030004:
A class used to refer to early passive-model
SOLDIERs. They are soon to be replaced
with active-grade SOLDIERs like Sephiroth.
902000000040001:
If you're having trouble creating a party for
a battle, use Recommended Formation. 
This method takes elements and sigils into
consideration and automatically forms an
optimal party.
902000000040002:
Raising a character's level increases their
HP, attack, and heal strength. Training
quests are the most efficient way to raise
levels.
902000000040003:
Raising the level of a weapon increases its
power. A weapon's level can also be
uncapped and raised even further.
Necessary materials can be obtained from
weapon enhancement quests.
902000000040004:
Unlocking nodes can increase a character's
stats and be used to acquire and enhance 
limit breaks. Necessary materials can be
obtained from training quests and premium
quests.
902000000040005:
Abilities with the requisite sigils can be used
to interrupt an enemy's stream phase. Make
sure to pay attention to the recommended
sigils when forming a party.
902000000040006:
When fighting an enemy with weaknesses,
attacks with the corresponding elements can
deal great damage. Choose the right abilities
for each battle.
902000000040007:
When facing enemies with powerful attacks, 
try using abilities that lower their strength or
boost your party's defense.
902000000040008:
When a weapon becomes <sprite="tmp_icon" index=196><sprite="tmp_icon" index=196><sprite="tmp_icon" index=196><sprite="tmp_icon" index=196><sprite="tmp_icon" index=196>, 
C. abilities gain powerful effects and
R. abilities become stronger.
902000000040009:
Materia come in different types and can be
synthesized with recipes. Rare materia have
powerful effects, so the more you have, the
more powerful your party.
902000000040010:
Keep the command gauge filled for greater
effects throughout battle. The gauge fills
during Attack Stance and depletes during
Defense Stance.
902000000040011:
Your party deals more damage, and sigils
are easier to destroy. Allies will focus on
offensive actions.
902000000040012:
Your party takes less damage, and recovery
effects from abilities are boosted. Allies will
focus on defensive actions.
902000000040013:
Enemies use abilities with various effects.
The names of powerful abilities will be
displayed when executed, so be prepared
when you see them.
902000000040014:
Destroy sigils to interrupt an enemy's stream
phase, incapacitating them and affording you
time to regroup or focus your attacks.
902000000040015:
In Criterion and Crisis Dungeons, taking
damage decreases your max. HP. This lost
HP will not be restored after battle, so avoid
taking damage if possible.
902000000040016:
In some dungeons, you can obtain items that
restore your max. HP, fill your limit gauge, or
provide other benefits. These items cannot
be taken outside the dungeon, so make sure
to use them.
902000000040017:
Every time you defeat a boss in Crisis
Dungeons, the enemies' levels increase.
Keep this in mind to build a strategy that
works for you.
902000000040018:
Select trance abilities based on your party or
the dungeons' bosses. Once you get the
hang of it, try and form parties to maximize
trance ability effects.
903000000000009: Crisis Dungeons Cleared with Rank S or Better
903000000000013: Floors Cleared in the Battle Tower
907000000051304: Buffs and Debuffs: No Tiers/Cannot Remove
908000000010101:
An indication of character growth. A character's level (Lv) increases
when a certain amount of experience is gained, also <color=#95C7FF>increasing their stats</color>.
908000000010102:
There are 6 types of character stats:
・HP
・Phys. Attack (PATK)
・Mag. Attack (MATK)
・Phys. Defense (PDEF)
・Mag. Defense (MDEF)
・Healing Potency (HEAL)
908000000010201:
Weapons each have a Level and Rarity, which determines their Stats and 
Abilities accordingly. 
You can <color=#95C7FF>Enhance Weapons</color> to <color=#95C7FF>improve their Stats</color>
and <color=#95C7FF>unlock or strengthen Abilities</color>.

The Stats and Abilities of a Weapon are applied to the character 
when the Weapon is equipped.
The types of Weapons that can be equipped as a 'Main Weapon' or 
'Ability Weapon' vary for each character.
908000000010301:
Main weapons are <color=#95C7FF>visually displayed as the character's equipment</color> during battle.
Equipping it has the following effects.

To the equipped character:
 *Weapon's stats are reflected.
 *<color=#95C7FF>C. Abilities become usable</color>.
 *<color=#95C7FF>R. Abilities are reflected</color>.

Equipped Materia:
 *The Materia's <color=#95C7FF>S. Abilities become usable</color>.
908000000010302:
Ability weapons, when equipped, have the following effects.

Character:
・<color=#95C7FF>50% of the weapon's stats are reflected</color>.
・<color=#95C7FF>The C. Ability can be used during battle</color>.
・<color=#95C7FF>50% of the R. Ability pts are reflected</color>.
908000000010303:
<color=#95C7FF>Sub Weapons</color>, when equipped, have the following effects.

Character:
 *<color=#95C7FF>50% of the weapon's stats are reflected</color>.
 *<color=#95C7FF>50% of the R. Ability pts are reflected</color>.

Unlike a main weapon, ability weapon and ultimate weapon, <color=#95C7FF>sub weapons</color> can be
equipped no matter the type.
908000000010304:
Equipping ultimate weapons has the following effects:

- Reflects weapon stats
- Allows use of <color=#95C7FF>U. C. abilities in battle</color>
- <color=#95C7FF>Reflects R. abilities</color>
908000000010401:
<color=#95C7FF>Materia</color>, when equipped, has the following effects:

Character:
 *<color=#95C7FF>The sub stats of the Materia are reflected</color>.
 *<color=#95C7FF>C. Abilities can be used in battle</color>.

Up to 3 <color=#95C7FF>Materia</color> can be equipped per character.
908000000010402:
Support Materia are non-removable Materia in a set of 3 per weapon.
The effects are unlocked sequentially as the weapon is enhanced and
the conditions are met.

The <color=#95C7FF>S. Abilities</color> of Support Materia also have <color=#95C7FF>an effect
on the Materia that is equipped in pair</color>. 
Depending on the combination of Materia, the S. Abilities may not activate.
908000000010501:
<color=#95C7FF>C. Abilities (Command Abilities)</color> can be used by consuming the ATB Gauge during battle. 
C. Abilities come in two types: <color=#95C7FF>physical</color> and <color=#95C7FF>magic</color>. 
The damage dealt by an ability is determined based on the relevant stats for its type. 

Some examples include: 
Physical: Fast Blade, Ruinra Smash, etc 
Magic: Fire, Thunder, Blizzard, etc
908000000010502:
Among the C. Abilities, there are those like Blizzaga A, which have an <color=#95C7FF>'A'</color> indicated
behind the ability name.

These are abilities that have <color=#95C7FF>broadened their range of effect</color>. 
Depending on the effect, they exert their effect on all characters or all enemies.
908000000010601:
<color=#95C7FF>L. Abilities (Limit Abilities)</color> can be used by consuming the Limit gauge during battles.
You can choose to equip either a character's unique <color=#95C7FF>Limit Break</color> or a <color=#95C7FF>Summon Ability</color>
that cannot be duplicated within the same party.
908000000010701:
<color=#95C7FF>R. Abilities (Reinforcement Abilities)</color> have a <color=#95C7FF>continuous effect during battle</color>.
The R. Ability Lv. is determined by the total points of the same effect R. Abilities
included in the character's equipment, and will adjust according to Lv.
908000000010801:
<color=#95C7FF>S. Abilities (Support Abilities)</color> affect <color=#95C7FF>the materia paired with the support materia</color>.
To unleash their effects, the support materia of the main weapon must be unlocked.
Also, depending on the combination of materia, some effects may not be activated.
908000000010901:
HP (Hit Points) indicate the amount of damage a character can withstand.
HP decreases when the character is attacked by an enemy.
When a character's HP reaches 0, they become unable to fight.
The game is over when all party members become unable to fight.
908000000010902:
The attack power when attacking physically. The higher the Phys. Attack,
the more the <color=#95C7FF>damage of the physical ability</color> increases.
908000000010903:
The attack power referenced when attacking with magic. 
The higher the Mag. Attack, the more the <color=#95C7FF>damage of magic type abilities</color> increases.
908000000010904:
The defense strength against physical attacks. 
The higher the Phys. Defense, the less <color=#95C7FF>damage will be taken
from physical attacks</color>.
908000000010905:
The defense strength against magic attacks. 
The higher the Mag. Defense, the less <color=#95C7FF>damage will be taken
from magical attacks</color>.
908000000010906:
The strength of recovery abilities. 
The higher the Healing Potency, <color=#95C7FF>the more the effect of the recovery ability
increases</color>.
908000000010907:
Affects the potency of abilities that have specific elements. 
If you have <color=#95C7FF>Boost Fire Pot.</color>, 
the damage of <color=#95C7FF>Fire abilities</color> will increase.
908000000010908:
The defense against specific elements. 
If a character has <color=#95C7FF>Fire Resist.</color>, 
the <color=#95C7FF>damage from fire attribute attacks</color> they receive will be reduced.
908000000010909:
A resistance to specific status ailments. 
If you have <color=#95C7FF>Poison Resist.</color>, 
you will be <color=#95C7FF>less likely to get poisoned when attacked by poison</color>.
908000000010910:
When using <color=#95C7FF>non-elemental attack abilities</color>, 
there is a chance of a <color=#95C7FF>critical hit occurring</color>.

The higher the <color=#95C7FF>Boost Crit. Pot.</color> value, 
the more damage will be dealt when a critical hit occurs.
908000000010911: The higher the critical hit rate, the more likely a critical will occur.
908000000011001:
A combination of characters and equipment for battle.
You can form parties for Solo and Co-op play.

A solo party is used to challenge <color=#95C7FF>solo content quests and dungeons</color>.

A co-op party is used to challenge <color=#95C7FF>co-op battles</color>. 
For story quests, the party will be automatically pre-made.
908000000011002:
Power is <color=#95C7FF>a numerical value that serves as a rough measure of strength</color>,
calculated based on the stats and abilities of a character and their equipment.

The Total Power is the sum of the power of all characters currently in your party.
This serves as an indicator for challenging battles.
908000000011003:
Rcmd. Party can automatically put together a party with optimized equipment. 
If you use Rcmd. Party just before <color=#95C7FF>challenging Solo Content or a Co-op Battle</color>, 
the party will be formed considering the <color=#95C7FF>recommended elements and sigils
for the battle</color>.

Best Equipment can automatically pick the equipment for your character displayed
on the Character screen.
908000000011004:
The character displayed as Leader will be the <color=#95C7FF>character you control
at the start of battle</color>.
908000000011005:
Multiple party compositions can be formed and saved.
Previously formed party information can also be copy and pasted into a different party
fomation slot.
908000000011101:
A <color=#95C7FF>Limit Break</color>, a <color=#95C7FF>character-specific special move</color>,
can be activated as the <color=#95C7FF>Limit Gauge</color> fills up during battle.
By selecting and equipping one of the available <color=#95C7FF>Limit Breaks</color> for the character,
it can be used during battle.
908000000011201:
When equipped instead of Limit Break,
it can be activated during battle as the <color=#95C7FF>Summon gauge accumulates</color>,
instead of the Limit gauge.

Even if multiple Summon Abilities have already been acquired,
the same summon cannot be equipped on more than one character in the same party.
908000000011301:
This is a character's gear. If you own the gear of the relevant character,
you can change the gear on the set screen.
908000000011303:
When assigning gear to a character, it will affect both the character's appearance
and their R. Ability pts.
908000000011401:
These abilities can be used in battle by equipping ultimate weapons. 
They can be used without consuming ATB, but there is <color=#95C7FF>a limit to the number of times</color> 
they can be used in a single battle and may require time to <color=#95C7FF>recharge</color>.
908000000011501:
O. abilities provide characters with temporary enhancements when used.
These abilities charge over time, and the duration of enhancements changes based on the time charged.
908000000011601:
Equipping <color=#95C7FF>memoria</color> has the following effects:

- All characters in the party gain the <color=#95C7FF>stats</color> attributed to the memoria.
- The party gains the effects of the memoria's <color=#95C7FF>M. abilities</color>.

The memoria's effects are <color=#95C7FF>reflected on all characters in the party</color>. However, there are M. abilities that only apply to certain characters.

*Memoria only affect your character in co-op battles.
908000000011602: Only <color=#95C7FF>one memoria can be equipped</color> by a party. An equipped memoria can also be equipped by another party at the same time.
908000000020101:
There are two ways to enhance a character.

- By <color=#95C7FF>raising a character's level</color>, all stats are increased.

- By <color=#95C7FF>unlocking nodes on the Character Stream</color>, each stat can be
enhanced individually, and the character's Limit Break can be enhanced.
908000000020102:
By consuming special items to unlock nodes, you can enhance a character's <color=#95C7FF>stats</color> and
strengthen <color=#95C7FF>obtained Limit Breaks</color>. 
It is also possible to obtain new Limit Breaks.
908000000020103:
Activate a node on the Character Stream using a dedicated item. 
This is usually done by using a Memory dedicated to the designated character.
908000000020104:
Items used to unlock nodes in each character's Character Stream.
Character-specific items can only be used in the Character Stream of the 
respective character.
908000000020105:
A mission to obtain a Limit Break.

By completing all of the requirements, you will obtain a Limit Break.
<color=#95C7FF>Only one Limit Break mission can be in progress at a time per character.</color>
You cannot attempt multiple Limit Break Missions at the same time.

When you change the Limit Break Mission, a <color=#95C7FF>cooldown period</color> will occur
for each character. During the cooldown period, you will not be able to switch
between Limit Break Missions.
908000000020106: You can enhance your characters' <color=#95C7FF>stats</color>, <color=#95C7FF>C./U. C./L. abilities</color>, and <color=#95C7FF>overspeeds</color> by unlocking nodes with certain items. You can also attempt to acquire new overspeeds.
908000000020107: Role memories are items required to unlock role stream nodes. Memories can only be used in respective role streams.
908000000020108: In these missions, overspeeds can be acquired by completing all mission conditions. Only <color=#95C7FF>one overspeed mission</color> can be attempted <color=#95C7FF>per character at a time</color>.
908000000020201:
By clearing Summon Missions, a <color=#95C7FF>Pact</color> can be formed with the Summon
to acquire new Summon Abilities. 
After forming a pact, you can <color=#95C7FF>unlock nodes by consuming special items</color> and
<color=#95C7FF>enhance Summon Abilities</color>.
908000000020202:
This item unlocks a node on a Summon Stream. Items specific to a summon can
only be used on the corresponding Summon Stream.
908000000020203:
This is a mission to bind a Summon or acquire Summon Abilities.

By fulfilling all the conditions, you can create a <color=#95C7FF>new pact with a Summon</color>
and <color=#95C7FF>acquire Summon Abilities</color>. 
Only one Summon mission can be carried out for all Summons, 
and you cannot challenge multiple at the same time.

When you change the Summon mission, a cooldown will occur for all Summons. 
During the cooldown period, you will not be able to switch between
Summon Missions.
908000000020301:
By consuming weapon enhancement materials, you can raise the level of
your weapon. 
As the weapon level increases, each of its stats will also increase. 
When you reach the max level, any excess experience will be returned to you as
enhancement materials.
908000000020302:
You can increase the Max. level of a weapon via <color=#95C7FF>uncap level</color>
by using special items. 
Weapons that have their level uncapped will have their <color=#95C7FF>Max. level increased
and can be further enhanced</color>.

The number of times you can uncap depends on the weapon's rarity,
with higher rarities having higher Max. levels.

By uncapping, you can gradually unlock and enhance R. Abilities, 
and unlock Support Materia.
908000000020303:
When enhancing weapons, a <color=#95C7FF>'Critical Success'</color> may occasionally occur,
allowing you to gain more EXP.
908000000020401:
Weapon rarity levels range from 3★ to 6★.
Between rarities 3★ to 5★, the higher the rarity, the higher the weapon's stats and ability effects.
6★ is a rarity exclusive to Ultimate Weapons.
908000000020402:
There are two ways to upgrade a weapon's rarity:

- If you acquire the same weapon from a Draw or as a reward and it has a higher rarity
than the one you already own, it will be <color=#95C7FF>automatically upgraded</color>.
- You can also upgrade rarity by using a special item on a weapon you already own
in the enhancement screen.
This allows you to <color=#95C7FF>upgrade rarity at will</color>.

When upgrading rarity, the weapon's current level will be carried over.
908000000020501:
5★ weapons can be pushed beyond their limits by using <color=#95C7FF>weapon parts</color>
specific to each weapon.

Depending on the weapon's <color=#95C7FF>Overboost</color> level, 
weapon stats, C. Abilities and R. Abilities can be enhanced.
908000000020601:
By consuming <color=#95C7FF>Materia enhancement materials</color> or <color=#95C7FF>other Materia</color>, 
you can enhance your Materia and increase its level. 

As the Materia's Level is increased, the abilities will be enhanced, 
and <color=#95C7FF>Sub Stats will also be unlocked and increased</color>.
908000000020602:
Materia that have reached their maximum level can be further enhanced by consuming items. 
Enhanced Materia will become higher-tier Materia, and their abilities will be <color=#95C7FF>enhanced</color>. 
Additionally, their maximum level will be increased, becoming even more powerful. 

The Materia's <color=#95C7FF>rarity</color> may increase when it is <color=#95C7FF>enhanced</color>.
908000000020701:
Ultimate weapons can be equipped in specific slots, 
and their <color=#95C7FF>levels</color> can be increased through <color=#95C7FF>weapon enhancement</color>.
 
Different characters can equip different weapons.
908000000020801:
<color=#95C7FF>Branding stones</color> can be used to brand weapons and apply <color=#95C7FF>new effects</color>.

The effects and their values are chosen <color=#95C7FF>at random</color>, but the type of stone dictates which effects are <color=#95C7FF>more likely to be chosen</color>.

Weapons can also be <color=#95C7FF>rebranded</color>, allowing you to choose between <color=#95C7FF>keeping the current effects or overwriting them with new ones</color>.
908000000020901:
- Enhanced weapons have preset levels, rarities, and overboost counts.
- When a duplicate weapon with a higher level, rarity, or overboost count is obtained, the higher value will be applied.
- Weapon parts corresponding to the difference between the already held weapon and the newly acquired enhanced weapon can be obtained.
- Weapon enhancement materials corresponding to the level difference between the already held weapon and the newly acquired enhanced weapon will not be returned.
- Pre-existing brands will be carried over.
- When an enhanced version of a weapon already held is obtained, a weapon conversion confirmation message will be displayed, allowing you to choose whether to claim the new weapon immediately.
- If the enhanced weapon is not immediately claimed, it will be sent to your gift box.
- The weapon conversion confirmation message can be toggled on/off in the Settings menu.
908000000021101: The character possesses the R. ability <sprite="tmp_icon" index=342>Reprieve.
908000000021102: While overspeed is active, the character gains <color=#95C7FF>damage immunity and all his ATB costs are reduced to 1</color>. Every time damage received during overspeed exceeds a certain percentage of max HP, the overspeed gauge is depleted. Leveling up Unknown Tuning will increase the character's PATK and MATK.
908000000030101:
When you obtain a <color=#95C7FF>synthesis recipe</color> for a Materia,
you can <color=#95C7FF>create it at will</color> by using the necessary materials.
908000000030102: Obtaining this allows you to synthesize the corresponding Materia.
908000000030103:
During synthesis, you have the option to select <color=#95C7FF>additional materials</color>.
Some materials may affect the <color=#95C7FF>rarity</color> of the completed Materia.
908000000030104:
After starting the synthesis, it will take time for the Materia to be completed. 
You can check the estimated synthesis time when selecting a recipe. 
The actual synthesis time is determined randomly at the start of the synthesis,
and you can check the remaining time on the synthesis screen. 

You can reduce the synthesis time with a <color=#95C7FF>Bookmark</color>.
908000000030105: An item that can shorten the required synthesis time.
908000000030201:
Materia will randomly receive up to 4 sub-stats. 

The sub-stats that are shown as ??? will be gradually unlocked as the Materia's level increases. 
If all 4 stat slots are filled and a certain level is reached,
<color=#95C7FF>1 of the 4 stats will be enhanced at random</color>.
908000000030202:
Materia rarity ranges from 1★ to 5★. 
The higher the rarity, the higher the effect of the Materia's ability.
908000000040101:
It's possible to play through the Story for each title.

In the Story, battles may occur within episodes, or you may explore Dungeons.

By clearing the episode and progressing the section, 
you can proceed to the next chapter when all sections are cleared.
908000000040201:
This is a mode where you challenge quests using a <color=#95C7FF>Story Quest Party</color>. 
The party members will be fixed for each episode.

By clearing this mode, you can earn <color=#95C7FF>1st Clear Rewards</color>. 
It is possible to play the same quests repeatedly,
but rewards can only be received on the <color=#95C7FF>first clear</color>.
If you lose a battle in the story, you can resume from before the battle started. 
At that time, the stats of the party members will return to the state before the battle started.
908000000040202:
Challenge quests with a <color=#95C7FF>party of your choice</color>. 
The number of characters usable is subject to the same restrictions as the Story Party.

Clearing this mode will still count as completing the episode, and allow you to progress
through the story.
908000000040203: Challenge battles in the story using either of the two party modes.
908000000040301:
You can temporarily suspend your game during the story.
Tap Suspend in the menu while progressing through the story to pause the game.
908000000040302:
View a log of all of the dialogue in the scene.
Tap Conversation Log in the menu to display it.
908000000040303:
Skip the current scene.
Tap the skip button on the right side of the screen.
If there is a battle or an upcoming choice, the story will be skipped up to that point.
908000000040304:
Automatically load the text in the scene.
Tap the auto button on the right side of the screen to enable this function.
908000000040401:
Dungeons are a general term for the fields where players control their characters.

In dungeons, you aim to clear by advancing the map while solving gimmicks, battling,
and opening chests.
908000000040402:
Approach and tap to receive rewards.
In <color=#95C7FF>story mode dungeons</color>, rewards can only be obtained once.
908000000040403:
Within dungeons, you can freely move your character.
There are two ways to move; <color=#95C7FF>sliding</color> and/or <color=#95C7FF>tapping</color>.

When sliding your finger across the screen, a virtual pad will appear,
and your character will move in the corresponding direction.

When you tap a walkable area, your character will move towards that point.
908000000040404: While moving across a <color=#95C7FF>dungeon</color>, players may encounter a battle.
908000000040405:
In story mode dungeons, after each <color=#95C7FF>battle</color>, the character's <color=#95C7FF>HP is restored to 100%</color>.
If a character's HP reaches 0 and they become unable to fight,
they will also be restored in the same way.

Some states, such as the Limit gauge, are carried over to the next battle,
with the exception of characters who have become unable to fight.
908000000040406:
There are various types of traps in the <color=#95C7FF>Dungeons</color>.
Operate them by getting close and tapping.
908000000040501:
When you clear a chapter, you'll be able to challenge <color=#95C7FF>EXTRA</color> battles.

These are high-difficulty battle contents where the bosses that appeared in the same chapter
will <color=#95C7FF>reappear even stronger</color>.
908000000040601:
If you replay a previously completed episode,
you will not be able to receive battle rewards (including EXP).

Chests in the dungeon that have already been opened once will also be marked as obtained.
908000000050101:
In battle, characters will <color=#95C7FF>automatically</color> attack enemies with their weapons at regular intervals.
You can activate abilities while monitoring the situation to prevent characters from becoming
incapacitated. Victory is achieved by reducing all enemies' <color=#95C7FF>HP to 0</color>.

Enemies may appear in <color=#95C7FF>multiple waves</color>, 
and victory is achieved by progressing to the final wave and defeating all enemies.

*If there is a boss, victory is achieved by defeating the boss.
908000000050102:
The ATB gauge <color=#95C7FF>increases over time</color>.
The gauge will stop increasing during enemy appearances,
and when the menu is open during battles. 
You can <color=#95C7FF>use C. Ability</color> by consuming the ATB gauge.
908000000050103:
There are abilities that can be activated during battle, some of which the player can <color=#95C7FF>activate
manually</color>, and some that will <color=#95C7FF>automatically activate</color>.

・Abilities that the player can manually activate: <color=#95C7FF>C. Abilities, L. Abilities, U. C. Abilities</color>
・Abilities that automatically activate in battle: <color=#95C7FF>R. Abilities, S. Abilities</color>
908000000050104:
<color=#95C7FF>C. Abilities and L. Abilities</color> are abilities that can be manually activated during battle
by consuming the <color=#95C7FF>ATB Gauge and the Limit Gauge</color> respectively.

<color=#95C7FF>U. C. Abilities</color> can be used without consuming ATB, but there is <color=#95C7FF>a limit to the number of times</color> they can be used in a single battle and may require time to <color=#95C7FF>recharge</color>.

They have various effects, such as attack, healing, stat enhancement, and status ailments. 
For elemental attacks, the damage varies depending on whether the target's weakness or
resistance is hit.
908000000050105:
<color=#95C7FF>R. Abilities and S. Abilities</color> are abilities that <color=#95C7FF>automatically take effect</color> during battles.

R. Abilities often directly influence a <color=#95C7FF>character's stats</color>.
S. Abilities affect the effects of a <color=#95C7FF>Materia's C. Ability</color>.
908000000050201:
There are 2 types of Command Stance: <color=#95C7FF>Attack or Defense</color>.

You can freely switch between them by <color=#95C7FF>tapping the Command icon</color> on the right side
of the screen during battles.

By maintaining a high Command Gauge, you can utilize their effects throughout the battle.
908000000050202:
<color=#95C7FF>Attack Stance</color> is a command specialized for offense.

・The <color=#95C7FF>damage dealt by the character increases</color>.
・All attack command abilities allow you to <color=#95C7FF>destroy the enemy's Sigil</color>.
・In the case of a Sigil-matching ability, the number of <color=#95C7FF>Sigils destroyed will increase</color>.

During <color=#95C7FF>Attack Stance</color>, the <color=#95C7FF>Command Gauge increases</color>, and the effect increases when
the gauge is at its maximum.
The actions of your allies will also become more attack-oriented.
908000000050203:
<color=#95C7FF>Defense Stance</color> is a command specialized for defending against enemies' attacks.

・The <color=#95C7FF>damage received by the character decreases</color>.
・The character's <color=#95C7FF>healing power increases</color>.

During <color=#95C7FF>Defense Stance</color>, the <color=#95C7FF>Command Gauge decreases</color>, and the effect decreases when
the gauge is at its minimum.
The actions of your allies will also become more defense and recovery oriented.
908000000050301:
<color=#95C7FF>Limit Breaks and Summon abilities</color> have powerful effects, but their gauge must be charged
in order to activate them. 
The required gauge amount varies depending on each Limit Breaks and Summon abilities. 
<color=#95C7FF>When the gauge is charged, you can activate it at any time</color>.

There is no limit to the number of times it can be activated during battles.
908000000050302:
When controlling characters equipped with <color=#95C7FF>Limit Break</color>, the <color=#95C7FF>Limit Gauge</color> will be displayed, 
which accumulates based on their actions during battles.

The <color=#95C7FF>Limit Gauge</color> increases when you <color=#95C7FF>use C. Abilities</color>, or <color=#95C7FF>take damage from enemies</color>.
908000000050303:
Characters equipped with a <color=#95C7FF>Summon Ability</color> will switch their Limit Gauge to the <color=#95C7FF>Summon
Gauge</color>. 

The Summon Gauge, like the Limit Gauge,
increases when you <color=#95C7FF>use a C. Ability</color> or <color=#95C7FF>receive damage from enemies</color>.
908000000050304:
Using Limit Break and Summon Ability continuously with party characters will result in
a <color=#95C7FF>Limit Combo</color>. 

Depending on the number of combos, a bonus multiplier will be applied to
the <color=#95C7FF>damage of each activated ability</color>.
908000000050401:
Enemies may have <color=#95C7FF>attributes that serve as weaknesses or resistances</color>. 
Attacking with an attribute that is a weakness <color=#95C7FF>increases the damage dealt to the enemy</color>. 
Attacking with an attribute that is a resistance <color=#95C7FF>reduces or absorbs the damage dealt</color>. 
The degree of weakness or resistance varies depending on the enemy. 
If the character you are controlling has an ability that corresponds to the enemy's weakness,
<color=#95C7FF>the attribute icon of the ability will glow</color>.
908000000050402:
Some enemies belong to given <color=#95C7FF>enemy types</color> and there are abilities that only activate for certain enemy types.

Enemies can belong to multiple enemy types.
908000000050501:
During battles, <color=#95C7FF>switch your attack target</color> by tapping the name displayed above the enemy. 
Party members will also aim at the targeted enemy. 
*In a Co-op Battle, this will only affect you.
908000000050601:
There are bosses that enter a special state called a <color=#95C7FF>Stream Phase</color>.
When <color=#95C7FF>Stream Phase</color> is activated, 
a gauge that indicates the start and end will appear at the top of the battle screen.
The following are some of the main effects during the <color=#95C7FF>Stream Phase</color>:

・During the <color=#95C7FF>Stream Phase</color>, there may be <color=#95C7FF>continuous advantageous effects</color> that benefit the
enemy.
・During the <color=#95C7FF>Stream Phase</color>, the <color=#95C7FF>enemy's behavior</color> may change.
・When the <color=#95C7FF>Stream Phase</color> ends, the enemy may use a <color=#95C7FF>powerful technique</color>.
908000000050602:
During stream phase, when the timer gauge advances to a <color=#95C7FF>"trigger" marker</color>, the enemy <color=#95C7FF>unleashes a powerful ability</color>. You can cancel these abilities by <color=#95C7FF>interrupting</color> the stream phase before it reaches the marker.

*If there are multiple markers, an ability will be triggered for each marker reached.
*The name of the next ability that will trigger is displayed in the upper portion of the battle screen.
908000000050701:
The icon displayed with numbers below the <color=#95C7FF>Stream Phase</color> gauge.
Some <color=#95C7FF>C. Abilities</color> of weapons and Materia also have <color=#95C7FF>Sigils</color>.

If attacking with an ability that matches the displayed <color=#95C7FF>Sigil</color>, it becomes a '<color=#95C7FF>Sigil Breaker</color>' and
the number decreases. 
Even if the ability does not match the <color=#95C7FF>Sigil</color>,
you can still perform a <color=#95C7FF>Sigil Breaker</color> if in <color=#95C7FF>Attack Stance</color>.
908000000050801:
During the stream phase, if you destroy all the <color=#95C7FF>Sigils</color> and reduce the number to 0,
the stream phase will be forcibly terminated, and an <color=#95C7FF>Interruption</color> will occur.
During the Interruption, the following effects occur:

・The fill rate of the <color=#95C7FF>ATB gauge</color> will increase.
・The effect of the <color=#95C7FF>Command Abilities</color> will be maximized.
・The <color=#95C7FF>enemy</color> will stop moving.

In addition, by destroying Sigils quickly, bonus time will be added to the Interruption.
908000000050901:
By tapping the character icon displayed on the left side of the screen,
you can <color=#95C7FF>switch the character you are controlling</color>.
908000000051001:
If the controlled character becomes incapacitated, the controlled character will 
automatically switch to another party member. 
A character who has become incapacitated cannot be revived during battle. 
If all party members become incapacitated, the battle will be lost. 

In some battles, you may be able to use Red Crystals or Blue Crystals to continue 
after losing.
908000000051101:
Battles have a time limit. If the time limit expires, the battle will end forcibly,
and it will be game over. 
You can check the remaining time at any point during a battle by opening the Menu.

*This applies to all battles regardless of the content, such as Story, quests, Dungeons,
and Co-op Battles. 
*Excluding the time when the Menu is open.
(In Co-op Battle, time passes even when the Menu is open.)
908000000051201: If you exit the app during a battle, you can resume that battle when you restart the app.
908000000051202:
You can switch between the following 3 modes to control characters during battle:

・<color=#95C7FF>MANUAL</color>
All actions are performed manually by the player.

・<color=#95C7FF>SEMI AUTO</color>
The controlled character will use <color=#95C7FF>C. Abilities automatically when the ATB gauge is full</color>.

・<color=#95C7FF>AUTO</color>
All actions with the exception of <color=#95C7FF>Limit Breaks are performed automatically</color>.
*Auto-ability settings for Limit and U. C. abilities can be changed.
908000000051203:
It's possible to speed up the flow of battle.
The interval between automatic weapon attacks, the rate at which the ATB gauge fills, 
and the movement speeds of characters and enemies will all be <color=#95C7FF>doubled</color>.

However, this does not apply to certain attacks used by some enemies, 
L. Abilities, and other instances where time temporarily stops.
908000000051301:
During battle, beneficial effects called <color=#95C7FF>buffs</color> and harmful effects called <color=#95C7FF>debuffs</color> can be applied
to enemies and characters.

Some buffs and debuffs have tiers.
You can check the details of the buff and debuff icons from the <sprite="tmp_icon" index=835> button.
908000000051302:
When <color=#95C7FF>the same type of buff or debuff</color> as a target's current buff or debuff is applied, 
its <color=#95C7FF>tier is raised</color> and <color=#95C7FF>duration extended</color>.

The maximum tier and duration of buffs and debuffs differ with each ability.
908000000051303:
When the opposite type of buff or debuff as a target's current buff or debuff is applied,
its <color=#95C7FF>tier is lowered</color> and <color=#95C7FF>duration reduced</color>.

Status ailment debuffs can be removed after a certain amount of time has passed or with
specific abilities.
908000000051304:
Some Buffs and Debuffs cannot be increased, decreased, or removed. 
Buffs and Debuffs that cannot be increased,
decreased, or removed are displayed with different colors and frames as follows:

<sprite="tmp_icon" index=324>Boost PATK
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=606>Boost PATK (Cannot be increased, decreased, or removed)
908000000051305:
Some enemies may have resistance to certain debuffs. 
Debuffs that lower elemental resistance only have an effect on enemies that have that
element as a weakness.

<sprite="tmp_icon" index=595>Mag. Resist. Up: Mag. Damage taken is reduced.

- Status Changes
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=321>Regen: HP is gradually restored.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=322>Invincible: Less Damage is taken.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=327>Haste: The ATB gauge fills faster. If Slow is granted, it is removed.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=342>Reprieve: Upon receiving lethal Damage, 1 HP will remain.
　Invincible Buff is granted, and a small amount of HP is recovered. (Only once)
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=334>Provoke: Attacks are focused on the target using Provoke.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=335>Veil: Veil blocks up to a certain amount of damage based on 
　the max HP of the affected, and is destroyed when damage exceeding that amount is taken. 
　If an enemy attack is nullified by Veil, any effect associated with that attack has no effect.
　*Some abilities have effects that are immune to Veil.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=346>Exploit Weakness: Increases damage dealt when exploiting an enemy's weakness.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=343>Phys. Resist. Up: Reduces physical damage taken.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=344>Mag. Resist. Up: Reduces magic damage taken.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=347>Amp.: While in an amplified state, relevant C./U. C. abilities will deal more damage once.
　After a relevant ability is used, the state will be canceled immediately.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=345>HP Gain: During this buff effect, each time a caster attacks an enemy with a C./U. C. Ability, 
　the caster recovers a specific percentage of maximum HP.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=348>Physical Damege Bonus: Applies additional damage when a physical ability is used.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=349>Magic Damege Bonus: Applies additional damage when a magic ability is used.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=350>Fire Damege Bonus: Applies additional damage when a fire ability is used.
